content:
• Friday, December 7, 2012
  • ZGNX

    Zogenix (NASDAQ:ZGNX) resumes trading following its earlier trading halt ahead the FDA...

    Zogenix (NASDAQ:ZGNX) resumes trading following its earlier trading halt ahead the FDA announcement on Zohydro, and quickly craters 38%, currently at $1.50.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:02 PM
  • SPRD

    Some Chinese ADRs were among the biggest tech losers today, possibly thanks to ongoing...

    Some Chinese ADRs were among the biggest tech losers today, possibly thanks to ongoing de-listing fears stemming from the SEC's lawsuits against the Chinese arms of the Big-4 accounting firms. SPRD -8.2%. YOKU -6.9%. AMAP -5.7%. On the other hand, some Chinese solar names posted huge gains, likely on hopes JinkoSolar's $1B financing deal with China Development Bank indicates government support for the cash-burning industry remains strong. TSL +9.6%. LDK +12.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:51 PM | 2 Comments
  • OLED

    Universal Display (PANL +5%) rallied strongly for the second day in a row. Likely helping was a...

    Universal Display (PANL +5%) rallied strongly for the second day in a row. Likely helping was a Digitimes report noting Taiwanese display manufacturers AU Optronics (NYSE:AUO) and Innolux continue to invest in ramping OLED production, albeit while struggling with near-term yield and resource issues. For now, PANL remains very dependent on Samsung' OLED panel output. (yesterday)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:40 PM
  • CEO

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: NXY +15%. PLCM +4%. AVGO +2%. UTIW +2%. ALXN...

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: NXY +15%. PLCM +4%. AVGO +2%. UTIW +2%. ALXN +2%. 
    After-hours top losers: DMND -4%. TCK -3%. GRPN -3%. DOW -2%. BK -2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:47 PM | 1 Comment
  • ZGNX

    A panel of non-FDA medical experts votes 11 to 2 not to approve Zogenix's (NASDAQ:ZGNX) Zohydro,...

    A panel of non-FDA medical experts votes 11 to 2 not to approve Zogenix's (NASDAQ:ZGNX) Zohydro, a hydrocodone pill for chronic pain. Several panel members said they were concerned that the product - which falls into the same drug class as powerful pain products such as OxyContin - didn't contain any features that would prevent drug abusers from tampering with the pill to get all of the active ingredient out at once. ZGNX CEO Hawley and President Farr will hold a conference call to discuss the outcome at 6:30 pm EST. (Webcast)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:39 PM | 1 Comment
  • CEO

    Canada's government officially approves Cnooc’s (NYSE:CEO) bid for Nexen (NXY) and...

    Canada's government officially approves Cnooc’s (NYSE:CEO) bid for Nexen (NXY) and Petronas' bid for Progress Energy (OTC:PRQNF). Prime Minister Harper also announces new guidelines for evaluating proposed takeovers by foreign state-owned enterprises. NXY +14.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:19 PM | 4 Comments
  • CEO

    Nexen (NXY) takes off, +11.8% AH after Reuters reports Canadian authorities have approved the...

    Nexen (NXY) takes off, +11.8% AH after Reuters reports Canadian authorities have approved the acquisition of Nexen by China's Cnooc (NYSE:CEO). The official announcement is scheduled for 5:00.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM
  • AAPL

    As Apple (AAPL -1.2%) sold off again, the USPTO made a preliminary ruling to invalidate all 20...

    As Apple (AAPL -1.2%) sold off again, the USPTO made a preliminary ruling to invalidate all 20 claims in an Apple multi-touch patent used in cases against Samsung and Motorola. Apple will doubtlessly appeal the ruling, which comes 6 weeks after the USPTO preliminarily invalidated Apple's "rubber-banding" patent. Meanwhile, the shipping date for the new 27" iMac, already stated by Apple to be supply-constrained, has been pushed out to January. The 21.5" iMac has a shipping time of 7-10 business days.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM | 14 Comments
  • SRPT

    Sarepta Therapeutics (SRPT -7.6%) reversed an early gain to continue its descent lower today,...

    Sarepta Therapeutics (SRPT -7.6%) reversed an early gain to continue its descent lower today, despite issuing a positive update from Phase IIb testing of its eteplirsen drug treatment for Duchenne muscular dystrophy. The company says data continues to show a statistically significant clinical benefit for patients after 62 weeks. Unfortunately, the stock has been in a steady decline since the company gave its presentation at the Deutsche Bank 2012 dbAccess BioFEST Conference in Boston on Tuesday.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM | 9 Comments
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN +22.8%) ended up staging a monumental rally/short-squeeze today, and it looks as...

    Groupon (GRPN +22.8%) ended up staging a monumental rally/short-squeeze today, and it looks as if Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) acquisition rumors were the trigger. Google famously made a $6B offer for Groupon a year before it went public; even after today's move, the company is presently worth just $3.1B. But Groupon's prospects aren't looking as rosy as they used to. Volume was nearly 3x the daily average. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM | 7 Comments
  • DMND

    Diamond Foods (NASDAQ:DMND): FQ4 EPS of $0.05 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $223.9M beats by $4M....

    Diamond Foods (NASDAQ:DMND): FQ4 EPS of $0.05 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $223.9M beats by $4M. Shares -3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • CBMX

    Shares of CombiMatrix Corporation (NASDAQ:CBMX) soar today, finishing up over 334% after the New...

    Shares of CombiMatrix Corporation (NASDAQ:CBMX) soar today, finishing up over 334% after the New England Journal of Medicine published two studies concluding chromonosomal microarray analysis (NYSE:CMA) is superior to standard karyotyping for identifying prenatal genetic abnormalities. CBMX currently is the only publicly traded firm offering CMA diagnostics. One caveat, despite today's big run - the shares still are down over 55% from its $20 peak at the beginning of the year.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • CEO

    After an initial pop higher, Nexen (NXY -6.6%) shares have been dropping ahead of the Canadian...

    After an initial pop higher, Nexen (NXY -6.6%) shares have been dropping ahead of the Canadian government's announcement after the close on its decision regarding Cnooc's (CEO +0.5%) proposed takeover. CEO had offered to acquire NXY for $27.50/share; shares were trading at $17.06 at the time of the deal announcement and ~$23.40 a few minutes ago.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM
  • CEO

    The Canadian government reportedly will announce approval of Cnooc's (CEO +0.3%) takeover of...

    The Canadian government reportedly will announce approval of Cnooc's (CEO +0.3%) takeover of Nexen (NXY +1.8%) at 5:00 ET today.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM | 3 Comments
  • IR

    Ingersoll-Rand (IR +1.3%) moves up after Credit Suisse recommended the shares today ahead of the...

    Ingersoll-Rand (IR +1.3%) moves up after Credit Suisse recommended the shares today ahead of the results from its strategic review. The firm says expectations aren't high and believes the update will be an upside surprise. CS currently rates the shares Outperform and ups its price target to $51 from $47.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM
  • SD

    SandRidge Energy (SD +6.6%) rallies on takeover speculation: "It's all related to TPG-Axon's...

    SandRidge Energy (SD +6.6%) rallies on takeover speculation: "It's all related to TPG-Axon's saber rattling in hopes of being able to bring about some sort of transaction," a Global Hunter analyst says, while pointing out SD's $4.3B debt load would pose a major obstacle to any deal.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:05 PM | 6 Comments
  • YPF

    Argentine state oil company YPF (YPF +6.2%) says it is in advanced talks with potential partners...

    Argentine state oil company YPF (YPF +6.2%) says it is in advanced talks with potential partners on the development of its shale assets, putting it on track to meet its investment goals and bring shale gas resources onstream after it was nationalized. YPF could complete a deal with Bridas Energy before year-end, and an agreement with Chevron (NYSE:CVX) likely will close in Q1 2013.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM | 1 Comment
  • ACTG

    Acacia Research (ACTG +3.7%) moves higher today after announcing that its subsidiary, Unified...

    Acacia Research (ACTG +3.7%) moves higher today after announcing that its subsidiary, Unified Messaging Solutions, has entered into a license and settlement agreement with Plentyoffish Media, resolving all litigation that was pending. Terms are not yet disclosed.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM
  • YNDX

    Yandex (YNDX +4.5%) has staged a nice rally over the last 3 days: the Russian search leader is...

    Yandex (YNDX +4.5%) has staged a nice rally over the last 3 days: the Russian search leader is up 11% from Tuesday's close. Unlike many international peers, Yandex has been quite successful at fending off Google (NASDAQ:GOOG): LiveInternet.ru pegs Yandex's local search share at 60.3%, close to a multi-year high and well above Google's 26.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM
  • ATHN

    athenahealth (ATHN +1.9%) trades higher today on an upgrade to Outperform at Leerink Swann and a...

    athenahealth (ATHN +1.9%) trades higher today on an upgrade to Outperform at Leerink Swann and a price range of $80 - $85 per share. Leerink says the company has solid long-term growth potential, based on strong enterprise sales momentum and sales leverage.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN +8.7%) is having another volatile Friday. Shares spiked around 11AM ET on heavy...

    Groupon (GRPN +8.7%) is having another volatile Friday. Shares spiked around 11AM ET on heavy volume, and have only moved higher since. Some are wondering if there's new speculation CEO Andrew Mason will get axed.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM
  • FTNT

    Fortinet (FTNT +2%) is higher today - some think John Chambers' remarks about Cisco stepping up...

    Fortinet (FTNT +2%) is higher today - some think John Chambers' remarks about Cisco stepping up its M&A activity are playing a role. Fortinet has been growing rapidly, and has successfully kept Cisco and others at bay in the UTM security hardware market. But it's also richly valued. Ruckus Wireless (RKUS +7.1%), which went public last month competes with Cisco in the enterprise/carrier Wi-Fi space, is up strongly, but its shares have been on a tear the whole week.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM
  • DXI

    Dejour Energy (DEJ +16.2%) executes a sale and farmout agreement covering ~7,450 acres of...

    Dejour Energy (DEJ +16.2%) executes a sale and farmout agreement covering ~7,450 acres of Piceance Basin lands to an unnamed "large NYSE-listed E&P with significant operations" in the area for an undisclosed cash amount and a commitment to carry DEJ through the drilling and completion of three earning wells. DEJ will retain a 20% working interest in the project.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM
  • CBMX

    Midday top 10 gainers: CBMX +184%. GTIM +48%. LTBR +18%. OTCQB:DLGC +17%. RECV +16%. UNXL +15%....

    Midday top 10 gainers: CBMX +184%. GTIM +48%. LTBR +18%. OTCQB:DLGC +17%. RECV +16%. UNXL +15%. PAMT +15%. OTCQB:TELK +14%. JKS +14%. XPLR +11%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: TOPS -23%. AMRN -19%. KUTV -15%. VTSS -13%. MBLX -11%. CHLN -11%. CHTP -9%. RGC -8%. CUR -8%. AACC -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM
  • ENB

    Enbridge (ENB +3.2%) powers higher on its plans to spend $6.2B on a series of projects to bring...

    Enbridge (ENB +3.2%) powers higher on its plans to spend $6.2B on a series of projects to bring growing volumes of Alberta and North Dakota light oil to market. There's enough shipper support to go ahead with the market access program, which will flow an additional 400K bbl/day to refineries in Ontario, Quebec and the U.S. Midwest. BMO lifts its price target on shares to $50 from $47.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM
  • ALXN

    Alexion Pharmaceuticals (ALXN -3.3%) dips after Citigroup intitiates coverage with a tepid...

    Alexion Pharmaceuticals (ALXN -3.3%) dips after Citigroup intitiates coverage with a tepid Neutral rating, saying its current risk/reward profile isn't attractive. The firm notes that ALXN is presently trading at a very high P/E multiple that reflects optimistic expectations for upward EPS revisions. If history is a guide, the company will need to post significant upside surprises to offset the natural multiple contraction that is likely ahead.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM | 1 Comment
  • SLCA

    U.S. Silica (SLCA +7.3%) initiated at Outperform with a $19 price target by Howard Weil, which...

    U.S. Silica (SLCA +7.3%) initiated at Outperform with a $19 price target by Howard Weil, which believes SLCA enjoys favorable demand trends in business segments and has put into place an expansionary path to more fully address its more robust end markets. SLCA is the best investment in capturing the trend of increased volume and intensity of sand usage in the oil and gas industry.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM
  • ACHC

    Acadia Healthcare (ACHC -3.2%) trades down after pricing its 10.5M share offering at $22.50 per...

    Acadia Healthcare (ACHC -3.2%) trades down after pricing its 10.5M share offering at $22.50 per share, a 1.5% discount to yesterday's close. The company intends to use the proceeds to fund its acquisition strategy, particularly the planned acquisitions of Behavioral Centers of America and AmiCare Behavioral Centers. BofA Merrill Lynch, Citigroup and Jefferies all acted as joint book-runners for the offering.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM
  • ABMD

    Abiomed (ABMD -6.4%) trades down today coming off a 2-day trading halt, touching a 52-week low...

    Abiomed (ABMD -6.4%) trades down today coming off a 2-day trading halt, touching a 52-week low of $11.80 after the company announced that the FDA Circulatory System Devices Panel voted to retain Class III status for the temporary ventricular support devices within the non-roller type cardiopulmonary bypass blood pumps category - which includes ABMD's Impella - rather than the lower-risk Class II category it had hoped for.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
  • GEO

    Geo Group (GEO +7%) moves higher today after its board gave the go-ahead for the private-prison...

    Geo Group (GEO +7%) moves higher today after its board gave the go-ahead for the private-prison operator to divest certain health-care assets as it moves toward converting itself into a REIT by 2013. The company also declared a special dividend of $5.68 a share, joining the growing ranks of companies issuing special payouts in an effort to stay in front of potential tax increases next year.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • GPOR

    Gulfport Energy (GPOR -2.3%) is cut to Hold from Buy at Stifel Nicolaus on valuation after a...

    Gulfport Energy (GPOR -2.3%) is cut to Hold from Buy at Stifel Nicolaus on valuation after a strong run based on its first seven Utica well results along with production growth guidance. With near-term downside risk to oil along with execution risk related to delivering the growth, the firm suggests investors move to the sidelines.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM
  • BKS

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (BKS +1.8%) trade higher after Schottenfield Group sends a letter to...

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (BKS +1.8%) trade higher after Schottenfield Group sends a letter to the company's board calling for an immediate spinoff of Nook Media into a separate company. "We believe the company's strategy to deploy 100 percent of its cash flow over the past three years into the Nook has been disastrous."
     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • AMRN

    Shares of Amarin (AMRN -20.5%) are getting hammered this morning on the back of yesterday's...

    Shares of Amarin (AMRN -20.5%) are getting hammered this morning on the back of yesterday's announcement that it was raising funds and will begin hiring a sales force to independently launch Vascepa. The news disappointed investors who had hoped the biotech would have a partner by now. The company has already undertaken extensive preparations to launch the drug, but had held off on the costly move of hiring its own sales staff.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM | 4 Comments
  • PSEC

    Prospect Capital (PSEC +2.5%) bumps its monthly distribution by 8.2% to $0.11/share,...

    Prospect Capital (PSEC +2.5%) bumps its monthly distribution by 8.2% to $0.11/share, representing an annualized dividend yield of 12.8% (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM | 6 Comments
  • DDD

    3D Systems (DDD +2%) is up a bit after BB&T starts coverage with a Buy and $60 PT. Shares...

    3D Systems (DDD +2%) is up a bit after BB&T starts coverage with a Buy and $60 PT. Shares have been digesting their big 2012 gains in recent weeks.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM | 2 Comments
  • MLCO

    Shares of Melco Crown (MPEL +3.2%) trade higher after JPMorgan upgrades the gaming company to...

    Shares of Melco Crown (MPEL +3.2%) trade higher after JPMorgan upgrades the gaming company to Overweight from Neutral. The firm isn't completely scared off by the recent crackdown by Chinese authorities on money laundering, viewed by some as a potential drag on area casino revenue.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM | 1 Comment
  • AIG

    More on the AIG talks on ILFC: An official announcement of the sale of the unit to a consortium...

    More on the AIG talks on ILFC: An official announcement of the sale of the unit to a consortium of Chinese firms could come early next week, reports Reuters, citing a source close to the situation. AIG +3.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM | 1 Comment
  • SOL

    ReneSola (SOL +4.1%) is higher after announcing a deal to provide 4.3MW of modules for an...

    ReneSola (SOL +4.1%) is higher after announcing a deal to provide 4.3MW of modules for an Italian solar project carried out by global electric utility E.ON. 4.3MW is far from a large contract, but it could open the door to additional deals with E.ON, and ReneSola can use all the good news it can get.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM
  • FCX

    Moody's was upbeat after Freeport McMoRan's (FCX +5%) big acquisitions even as its share price...

    Moody's was upbeat after Freeport McMoRan's (FCX +5%) big acquisitions even as its share price was pummeled, cutting its outlook to stable from positive but keeping its rating at Baa3, three notches above junk. FCX has more than enough capacity to handle the interest expense despite the added debt, and the Plains addition will boost short-term EBITDA and cash flow, the ratings firm says.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM
  • JKS

    JinkoSolar (JKS +10.2%) has jumped out of the gate after announcing a $1B, 5-year financing deal...

    JinkoSolar (JKS +10.2%) has jumped out of the gate after announcing a $1B, 5-year financing deal with China Development Bank. Jinko says it will use the deal, whose terms still need to be hammered out, to help expand overseas. Like industry peers, Jinko has been posting huge losses and has a significant debt load.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM | 1 Comment
  • DECK

    Deckers Outdoor (DECK +4%) races higher at the open. A flurry of buying into heavily-shorted...

    Deckers Outdoor (DECK +4%) races higher at the open. A flurry of buying into heavily-shorted stocks could be behind the rally along with some new calls on Deckers being a takeover candidate.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM
  • AIG

    AIG gains 2.5% on news it may sell ILFC in a deal valuing the aircraft leasing unit at $5.5B. It...

    AIG gains 2.5% on news it may sell ILFC in a deal valuing the aircraft leasing unit at $5.5B. It may be less than what the company could fetch in an IPO, but then again, maybe not. In any case, it frees up more cash to repurchase stock at well below book value. Merrill Lynch likes what it hears, and reiterates the shares a Buy.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM
  • AET

    Aetna (AET +2.4%) settles for $120M (subject to judge's approval) a class action suit...

    Aetna (AET +2.4%) settles for $120M (subject to judge's approval) a class action suit relating to payments of claims to Aetna members who were served by non-contracted health-care providers. In other news, the stock is upgraded to Overweight with $52 price target by JPMorgan.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:34 AM
  • SLS

    Galena Biopharma (GALE) +7.8% premarket after saying studies of its NeuVax treatment continue to...

    Galena Biopharma (GALE) +7.8% premarket after saying studies of its NeuVax treatment continue to demonstrate excellent safety and efficacy profiles.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:30 AM
  • BCRX

    BioCryst Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:BCRX) -4.1% premarket after announcing it will lay off 50% of...

    BioCryst Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:BCRX) -4.1% premarket after announcing it will lay off 50% of its workforce as part of a restructuring program aimed at cutting costs while advancing its antiviral program and its program for hereditary angioedema, an immune system disorder.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:24 AM
  • BGG

    Briggs & Stratton (NYSE:BGG) is off to the races, moving up 17.5% premarket to hit $23.75 a...

    Briggs & Stratton (NYSE:BGG) is off to the races, moving up 17.5% premarket to hit $23.75 a share. While the company has been the subject of M&A chatter, today's dramatic move isn't tied to any official news.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM | 2 Comments
  • SLS

    Premarket gainers: GALE +9%. ACRX +7%. Losers: AMRN -19%. ABMD -7%. QRE -5%.

    Premarket gainers: GALE +9%. ACRX +7%. 
    Losers: AMRN -19%. ABMD -7%. QRE -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • SHLDQ

    Sears Holdings (SHLD) moves up 3.1% premarket after shares dipped below the $40 mark for the...

    Sears Holdings (SHLD) moves up 3.1% premarket after shares dipped below the $40 mark for the first time since January. Hedgeye's Keith McCullough thinks high short interest names such as Sears are scaring hedge funds in the current atmosphere. If that's the case, a short squeeze rally into year end could be on tap.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:59 AM | 16 Comments
  • BAGL

    Shares of Einstein Noah Restaurant (NASDAQ:BAGL) run up 8.8% premarket after the firm completes...

    Shares of Einstein Noah Restaurant (NASDAQ:BAGL) run up 8.8% premarket after the firm completes a strategic review and decides to recapitalize. The restaurant will tap existing credit facilities for funds to be used in part for a special dividend of $4 a share.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:31 AM
  • DDC

    Shares of Harry Winston Diamond (HWD) fall 9.1% premarket after the company boosted sales in its...

    Shares of Harry Winston Diamond (HWD) fall 9.1% premarket after the company boosted sales in its mining and luxury businesses during Q3 but issues guidance below the expectations of analysts. The shine might be off shares a bit after the firm revealed it wasn't in any active talks to sell itself after tipping off in October it received indications of interest.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:26 AM

  • More on the euro: A leak out of the ECB says a majority of the governing council support a...

    More on the euro: A leak out of the ECB says a majority of the governing council support a rate cut, suggesting to be prepared for one in early January. A cut in the overnight lending rate would bring it to 0.5%, but a cut in the deposit rate would bring that into negative territory. It's a new world. The euro briefly falls below $1.29 before quickly reclaiming the level.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:51 AM

  • The Bundesbank's deepening pessimism for the German economy, which follows the ECB cutting its...

    The Bundesbank's deepening pessimism for the German economy, which follows the ECB cutting its eurozone growth forecasts yesterday, helps send the euro tumbling 0.3% to $1.2919. The yen briefly spikes against the dollar after a 7.3 magnitude earthquake off Japan's northeast coast but has settled back to be flat on the day at 82.37 yen.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 AM | 1 Comment

  • Asian and European stocks are mixed, with China ending the week on a high. The Bundesbank...

    Asian and European stocks are mixed, with China ending the week on a high. The Bundesbank slashing its German GDP forecasts is weighing on sentiment, while investors are also focusing on the U.S. jobless data later today. Japan -0.2%, Hong Kong -0.3%, China +1.6%, India flat. Euro Stoxx 50 +0.1%, London -0.1%. Paris +0.1%. Frankfurt flat, Milan -0.8%, Madrid -0.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 AM
